intro: Lomaria exaltata, commonly known as the tall lomaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in the spring and early summer. Lomaria exaltata is often found in grasslands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
